podcasts.band: Red Animal War and many others, Filmmaker
podcasts.links:
Red Animal War
A Fat Wreck
Filmage: The Story of Descendents/All
podcasts.description: I first became aware of Justin through Red Animal War, but this dude has been in many other bands. He is also a filmmaker that has been involved in documentaries covering Fat Wreck Chords and The Descendents. Justin is a very talented dude and I was honored that he was able to stop by and chat about the tons of things he is involved in.

podcasts.description: Jeff and Tom stopped by to talk about Hoaries/Creepeth. I have liked these guys writing styles for quite some time now and it was an honor to have them on. I am really looking forward to more music from both Hoaries and Creepeth.

podcasts.description: The dudes in Whep stopped by for this episode. They are from the Dallas/Denton area and are a really great band and group of dudes. I found their bassist Joseph to be hilarious. Check these dudes out!

podcasts.description: David is the sound engineer up at double-wide, a photographer, a musician, and a mic builder. He is busy as shit to say the least. Back in the day he started a label which signed my first band and some odd years later I get to talk to him about how that had such a positive affect on me. He also use to play in a band called [DARYL] which is making a comeback! I'm stoked to say the least. Great dude and this was a blast to have him on.

podcasts.description: First episode of the new year and I have Aztec Death join me. I have been enjoying their music lately and that is all thanks to JT. These guys were a ton of fun to talk to and are really talented. If you are into dark wave or any other type of wave check these guys out.

podcasts.description: Kevin and Irving joined me for glorious episode 20! They play in Cognizant which is a brutal metal band. I really like the way Irving writes a ton. If you have not checked them out give them a listen. Bork at the mooooooooon!

podcasts.description: My long time buddy Andrew Hawkins joined me to talk about Baring Teeth finally!! I love every member of this band and they are some of the most talented musicians I have ever been around or seen. Do yourself a favor and check out the genius that is Baring Teeth!

podcasts.description: I had the honor of having BULLS on the podcast. Holy hell these guys are rad. I will say this podcast goes long but it was so much fun talking with these dudes. Alcohol was involved and we had to hit the pause button a couple of times but it was an amazing time!

podcasts.description: Daron stopped by on this episode and this one was a ton of fun. We talked about one of the best places to ever exist, Crystals pizza. I think this dude is so talented and it was a pleasure to be able to chat with him about movies, creepy shit, etc. If you haven't heard Pinkish Black you are missing out!

podcasts.description: Chris and Cole from Easy Prey stopped by for episode 16. They made the treck from Austin and and stayed with me so we could go bro down. I had a great time talking with these dudes and can't wait for our show together later this month.

podcasts.description: Ryan and Brandon from Honey Lotus came by for this episode. Ryan and I have know each other for years and he play in Broadcast Sea with me. We got a chance to reminisce and I was able to meet Brandon. This was a fun podcast and I loved having them on.
podcasts.description_raw: Ryan and Brandon from Honey Lotus came by for this episode. Ryan and I have know each other for years and he play in Broadcast Sea with me. We got a chance to reminisce and I was able to meet Brandon. This was a fun podcast and I loved having them on.

podcasts.description: Brian is one dope ass dude. He swung by for this episode and we talked about gear, doom, wax ruins, wood working and fishing. I'm glad a got a chance to sit down with Brian and learn more about him.

podcasts.description: JT stopped by on this episode to talk about our upcoming shows and The West Windows. They are about to go into the studio with my buddy Britt. Again, I love this dude!

podcasts.description: Oliver stopped by and I have to say he is one of the nicest dudes I've ever met. He is an author, poet, music journalist, and throws shows. This dude is fascinating and I had the honor to get to find out more about him. He just released his first book Destruction: Text I. Peep that amazon link!

podcasts.description: Eric is a writer, musician, author, traffic reporter, awesome dude. He has written two books, Post: A Look at the Influence of Post Hardcore and When We Were the Kids. I had an awesome time getting to know Eric and talk about all sorts of different things. He just played his first show in Caved Mountains and hopefully there will be more. Great time with a great dude.

podcasts.description: Sean and Nan of Little Beards stopped by in this episode. I got the chance to talk to them about their upcoming tour, ZZ top, and received a surprise delivery in the middle of the podcast. I have always loved Sean's musicianship and it was a great pleasure getting to chat with his wife Nan. True staples of Dallas music.

podcasts.description: Elisa is one of my wife's best friends. She runs neon cart which is an online vintage/thrift store based out of Austin, Texas. In this episode we just talk and have a fun time. My wife also joins in.

podcasts.description: Chris and Justin from Stealers dropped by on this episode. This was a super fun podcast and we got the chance to hear a song from their new album 'Thin Ice'. They are playing a couple of album release shows coming up this month in August. Check them out and pick up a copy!

podcasts.description: I've known Riley for a long time and it was great catching up and talking about comics, touring, and tons of other stuff. He plays in Power Trip from Dallas, Tx and they have recently put out a record entitled 'Nightmare Logic'. This dude is solid and I'm glad he's doing it big because he deserves it.

podcasts.description: The Angelus is a Dallas, Tx based group that has recently put out a record entitled 'There Will Be No Peace'. I got the chance to meet and site down with Emil and it was a great pleasure to have him on the podcast. Not only is this dude amazing but his band is fantastic.

podcasts.description: Tyrannosorceress is a Dallas, Tx based black metal band that has recently put out a record entitled 'Shattering Light's Creation'. I've known these guys for a while and not only are they super fun dudes but are also great fucking musicians. We sat down to talk about life, music, and PINK FLOYD!

podcasts.description: JT Ward is a Dallas, Tx based musician who plays in West Windows and Death Stairs. I met JT by reaching out to him about playing some shows together and come to find out we listen to a lot of the same music. We connected from the get go and this dude is extremely talented. Check out his bands, they rule!

podcasts.description: Javier Somoza is a Dallas, Tx based musician who plays in Weezing and Sleep Sweet. He is also a huge karaoke enthusiast. This dude is amaze balls.

podcasts.description: Adam Bertholdi is a Denton, Tx based musician who plays in Cozy Hawks. He has previously played in Gazelles and A Faith Called Chaos. Cozy Hawks are currently looking for a drummer so if you are interested hit them up!

podcasts.links:
Cloudland Recording Studio
Most Efficient Women
podcasts.description: Britt Robisheaux is an audio engineer at Cloudland Recording Studio in Fort Worth, Texas and currently plays in Most Efficient Women and Theater Fire. He has previously played in Drug Mountain and Nouns Group. If you are in need of a great recording book some time with Britt.
